column4: Is there a way to redirect output from a started program (for insatnce, in the middle fo a long ls listing, is there a way to redirect it to a file)?
myProgram > fileName
or, to capture all the output, including errors etc.:
myProgram &2> filename
That won't work in the middle of a program, right?
of course not
So, is there a way to redirect it in the middle of execution=
you'll have to shut it down and re-run it, sorry
Are you sure?
Why are you using this?
What do you mean?
If there is a service running you don't want to shut down, it probably performs /var/log messages anyway
My scenario: started long make build, want to filter it trhough grep in the middle of it
you can cancel this
make will continue where it stopped
(it should)
except, if you wrote the Makefile manually and it's not something ordinary
That is true, though it would be nice if there was a way
It feels like it should be possible, but what the heck
Thanks anyway
no problem
